text:
SPEAKER 1: 637 is the number
of days until graduation.
Every day counts.

SPEAKER 2: I would like
to be the first to welcome

Harvard Business School
MBA Class of 2020.
SPEAKER 3: Are you ready?
AUDIENCE: Yes.
SPEAKER 3: Here we go.

SPEAKER 4: I'm just
looking forward

to everything, you know, the
ups and downs and the academic
and the social experience.

I really can't think
of a single thing
that I'm not looking forward to.

I've heard that you make
friends for a lifetime here.

SPEAKER 5: It feels
really comfortable here.

It definitely feels
like a family.

And I just can't wait to kind
of make our own mark at HBS.
SPEAKER 6: Go!

SPEAKER 7: I'm going to go to
Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam.

SPEAKER 8: Accra, Ghana, and
I have never been to Africa
before.

SPEAKER 9: I'm going to Bangkok,
Thailand, and I feel amazing.
[STUDENTS CHEER]

SPEAKER 10: I could have
not imagined a better MBA
experience.

You all are the reason these
two years were so special.

You were my family, my
friends, and my mentors.

You challenged me and
inspired me to become
a better version of myself.

SPEAKER 11: We welcomed
new faces into our homes.

We stood and applauded
for visiting parents.

We remembered a partner's
name and treated them
as part of the family.

Time and time again,
we reminded each other

what makes Harvard
Business School so unique.
It's the people.

SPEAKER 12: We find
ourselves in a time
of unfathomable contrasts.

Coming off of some of the
best years of our lives

into an unprecedented
climate of turmoil.

But I think we're
powerful, and we are just
growing into our own strength.

SPEAKER 13: We've already
developed a prototype.

SPEAKER 14: mosaic is a
healthcare data aggregator
in App Store.

SPEAKER 10: And
never have I been

more proud of our
global community

than during these last weeks
because despite everything that

is happening around
us, we are part

of the community of
exceptional individuals.
Hope always prevails.

SPEAKER 15: Class of 2020,
wherever in the world

you are right now and
whatever you're wearing,

enjoy the journey as you venture
into the great unknown armed

with the people
and the experiences
this place has given us.
